GameState

Class StageOneState

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameState.GameState
      • GameState.StageOneState

  • public class StageOneState
extends GameState
    This class is the state in which Leukocytic Defense is played, and draws the game accordingly.
    Version:
    4.0 June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Kareem Golaub

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: GameState
        Abstract method, used for initialization in other classes that implements this abstract class.
        Specified by:
        init in class GameState

      • update

        public void update()
        This method updates every change in the game state such as mobs spawning, mobs being shot, and mobs being quarantined. It also sets the win screen and adds bone marrow and score and level accordingly. Quiz is also shown!
        Specified by:
        update in class GameState

      • showQuiz

        public void showQuiz()
        This method loads and shows the quiz between each stage. It adds bone marrow (coins) if the quiz is answered correctly.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method overrides the abstract method draw from gamestate.
        Specified by:
        draw in class GameState
        Parameters:
        g - java.awt.Graphics2D reference variable.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method overrides the abstract method paintComponent from gamestate. It draws what needs to be currently displayed on the screen.
        Specified by:
        paintComponent in class GameState
        Parameters:
        g - java.awt.Graphics reference variable.
